strings of the same length. Return None in case the input vector is empty.

>>> longest({"a", "b", "c"})
"a"

#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
string longest(vector<string> strings){
    string out;

    if(strings.empty()){
        return out;
    }

    for(string s: strings){
        if(s.length() > out.length()){

        }
    }

    return out;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Create a function that takes a string as input which contains only square brackets.
The function should return true if and only if there is a valid subsequence of brackets
where at least one bracket in the subsequence is nested.

is_nested("[[]]")  true
is_nested("[]]]]]]][[[[[]")  false
is_nested("[][]")  false
is_nested("[]")  false
is_nested("[[][]]")  true
is_nested("[[]][[")  true
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
bool is_nested(string str){
    for (int i = 0; i < str.length(); i++) {
        if (str[i] == ']')
            continue;

        int cnt = 0, max_nest = 0;
        for (int j = i; j < str.length(); j++) {
            if (str[j] == '[')
                cnt++;
            else
                cnt--;
            if (cnt > max_nest)
                max_nest = cnt;
        }
        if (cnt > 0)
            return false;
    }
    return true;
}

You need to return the sum of squared numbers in the given vector,
round each element in the vector to the upper int(Ceiling) first.
Examples:
For lst = {1,2,3} the output should be 14
For lst = {1,4,9} the output should be 98
For lst = {1,3,5,7} the output should be 84

#include<stdio.h>

<|endoftext|>/*
Create a function which returns the largest index of an element which
is not greater than or equal to the element immediately preceding it. If
no such element exists then return -1. The given vector will not contain
duplicate values.

Examples:
can_arrange({1,2,4,3,5}) = 3
can_arrange({1,2,3}) = -1
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
int can_arrange(vector<int> arr){

    int largest = arr[0];
    int index = 0;
    for(int i = 1; i < arr.size(); i++){
        if(arr[i] > largest){
            largest = arr[i];
            index = i;
        }
    }
    return index;
}

compare_one("1", 1)  "None"
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
#include<algorithm>
#include<boost/any.hpp>
using namespace std;
boost::any compare_one(boost::any a,boost::any b){
    double  numa,numb;
    boost::any out;
   
    if (a.type()==typeid(string))
    {
        string s;
        s=boost::any_cast<string>(a);
        if (find(s.begin(),s.end(),',')!=s.end())
            for (int i=0;i<s.length();i++)
                if (s[i]==',') s=s.substr(0,i)+'.'+s.substr(i+1);
        numa=atof(s.c_str());
        
    }
    else 
    {

        numa=boost::any_cast<double>(a);
    }

        string s;

        numb=atof(s.c_str());
        
    }
    else 
    {

        numb=boost::any_cast<double>(b);
    }
    
    if (numa>numb)
        out=b;
    else 
        out=a;
    
    return out;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
The Brazilian factorial is defined as:
brazilian_factorial(n) = n! * (n-1)! * (n-2)! *... * 1!
where n > 0

For example:
>>> special_factorial(4)
288

The function will receive an integer as input and should return the special
factorial of this integer.
*/
#include<stdio.h>
using namespace std;
long long special_factorial(int n){
    long long fact=1,bfact=1;
    for (int i=1;i<=n;i++)
        fact=fact*i;
    for(int i=1;i<=n;i++){
        bfact=bfact*i;
    }
    return fact*bfact;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Return vector of all prefixes from shortest to longest of the input string
>>> all_prefixes("abc")
{"a", "ab", "abc"}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<string> all_prefixes(string str){
    vector<string> out;
    string current="";

    for(int i=0;i<str.size();i++){
        if(str[i]=='\0'){
            out.push_back(current);
            current="";
        }
        else{
            current+=str[i];
        }
    }
    out.push_back(current);
    return out;
}

Given two positive integers a and b, return the even digits between a
and b, in ascending order.

For example:
generate_integers(2, 8) => {2, 4, 6, 8}
generate_integers(8, 2) => {2, 4, 6, 8}

#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<int> generate_integers(int a,int b){
    int m;
    if (b<a)
    {

        v.reserve(a-b+1);
        for (int i=a;i<b;i++)

            v.push_back(i);
        }
        return v;

<|endoftext|>/*
Find how many times a given substring can be found in the original string. Count overlaping cases.
>>> how_many_times("", "a")
0
>>> how_many_times("aaa", "a")
3
>>> how_many_times("aaaa", "aa")
3
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
int how_many_times(string str,string substring){
    int out=0;

    for(int i=0;i<str.size();i++){
        if(str[i]==substring[0]){
            for(int j=1;j<substring.size();j++){
                if(str[i+j]!=substring[j]){
                    out++;
                    break;
                }
            }
        }
    }
    return out;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Filter an input vector of strings only for ones that start with a given prefix.
>>> filter_by_prefix({}, "a")
{}
>>> filter_by_prefix({"abc", "bcd", "cde", "vector"}, "a")
{"abc", "vector"}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<string> filter_by_prefix(vector<string> strings, string prefix){

    vector<string> filtered;
    for(string s: strings){
        if(s.substr(0, prefix.size()) == prefix){
            filtered.push_back(s);
        }
    }
    return filtered;
}

/*
Filter an input vector of strings only for ones that end with a given suffix.
>>> filter_by_suffix({}, "a")
{}
>>> filter_by_suffix({"abc", "bcd", "cde", "vector"}, "a")
{"abc", "vector"}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<string> filter_by_suffix(vector<string> strings, string suffix){

    vector<string> filtered;
    for(string s: strings){
        if(s.substr(string::npos, suffix.size()) == suffix){
            filtered.push_back(s);
        }
    }
    return filtered;
}

/*
Filter an input vector of strings only for ones that contain a given substring.
>>> filter_by_substring({}, "a")
{}
>>> filter_by_substring({"abc", "bcd", "cde", "vector"}, "a")
{"abc", "vector"}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<string> filter_by_substring(vector<string> strings, string substring){

    vector<string> filtered;
    for(string s: strings){
        if(s.find(substring)!= string::npos){
            filtered.push_back(s);
        }
    }
    return filtered;
}

/*
Filter an input vector of strings only for ones that do not contain a given substring.
>>> filter_by_not_substring({}, "a")
{}
>>> filter_by_not_substring({"abc", "bcd", "cde", "vector"}, "a")
{"abc", "bcd", "cde"}

#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<string> filter_by_not_substring(vector<string> strings, string substring){

    vector<string> filtered;
    for(string s: strings){
        if(s.find(substring) == string::npos){
            filtered.push_back(s);
        }
    }
    return filtered;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Return true if a given number is prime, and false otherwise.
>>> is_prime(6)
false
>>> is_prime(101)
true
>>> is_prime(11)
true
>>> is_prime(13441)
true
>>> is_prime(61)
true
>>> is_prime(4)
false
>>> is_prime(1)
false
*/
#include<stdio.h>
using namespace std;
bool is_prime(long long n){
    if (n<2) return false;

    long long i=2;
    long long count=0;

    while(i*i<=n){
        if(n%i==0){
            count++;
        }
        i++;
    }
    if(count==0) return false;
    else return true;
}

    return sum;

<|endoftext|>/*
For a given vector of input numbers, calculate Mean Absolute Deviation
around the mean of this dataset.
Mean Absolute Deviation is the average absolute difference between each
element and a centerpoint (mean in this case):
MAD = average | x - x_mean |
>>> mean_absolute_deviation({1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0})
1.0
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
float mean_absolute_deviation(vector<float> numbers){
    float sum=0;
    float avg,msum,mavg;
    int i=0;

    avg=numbers[0];
    msum=numbers[0];
    mavg=numbers[0];
    for(i=0;i<numbers.size()-1;i++){
        sum+=numbers[i];
        msum+=numbers[i];
        avg=sum/i;
    }
    for(i=0;i<numbers.size()-1;i++){
        mavg=msum;
        msum=sum;
        sum=avg;
        avg=sum/i;
    }
    return sqrt(sum/numbers.size());
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Change numerical base of input number x to base.
return string representation after the conversion.
base numbers are less than 10.
>>> change_base(8, 3)
"22"
>>> change_base(8, 2)
"1000"
>>> change_base(7, 2)
"111"
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
string change_base(int x,int base){
	if (x == 0){
		return "0";
	}
    string out="";
    while (x>0){
        int rem = x%base;
        out += (char)('0'+rem);
        x /= base;
    }
    return out;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Return true if all numbers in the vector l are below threshold t.
>>> below_threshold({1, 2, 4, 10}, 100)
true
>>> below_threshold({1, 20, 4, 10}, 5)
false
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
bool below_threshold(vector<int>l, int t){

    for(int i=0;i<l.size();i++){
        if(l[i]<t)
            return false;
    }
    return true;
}

false

true
*/

using namespace std;
bool above_threshold(vector<int>l, int t){

    for(int i=0;i<l.size();i++){
        if(l[i]>t)
            return false;
    }
    return true;
}

/*
Return true if all numbers in the vector l are in the range [a, b].
>>> in_range({1, 2, 4, 10}, 1, 10)
true
>>> in_range({1, 20, 4, 10}, 1, 10)
false
>>> in_range({1, 20, 4, 10}, 1, 5)
true
>>> in_range({1, 20, 4, 10}, 1, 100)
true
>>> in_range({1, 20, 4, 10}, 1, 0)
true
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
bool in_range(vector<int>l, int a, int b){

    for(int i=0;i<l.size();i++){
        if(l[i]>=a && l[i]<=b)
            return true;
    }
    return false;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
sum_to_n is a function that sums numbers from 1 to n.
>>> sum_to_n(30)
465
>>> sum_to_n(100)
5050

15

55
>>> sum_to_n(1)

#include<stdio.h>
using namespace std;

int sum_to_n(int n){
    int sum = 0;
    for(int i = 1; i <= n; i++){
        sum += i;
    }
    return sum;
}

/*

30
>>> max_to_n(100)
100
>>> max_to_n(5)
5
>>> max_to_n(10)
10
>>> max_to_n(1)
1
*/
#include<stdio.h>
using namespace std;

int max_to_n(int n){
    int max = n;
    for(int i = 1; i <= n; i++){
        if(max < i){
            max = i;
        }
    }
    return max;
}

>>> min_to_n(30)
1
>>> min_to_n(100)
1
>>> min_to_n(5)
1
>>> min_to_n(10)
1
>>> min_to_n(1)
1
*/
#include<stdio.h>
using namespace std;

int min_to_n(int n){
    int min = n;
    for(int i = 1; i <= n; i++){
        if(min > i){
            min = i;
        }
    }
    return min;
}

/*
The function average_to_n is a function that finds the average of numbers from 1 to n.
>>> average_to_n(30)
15.0
>>> average_to_n(100)
50.0
>>> average_to_n(5)
5.0
>>> average_to_n(10)
10.0
>>> average_to_n(1)
1.0
*/
#include<stdio.h>
using namespace std;

double average_to_n(int n){
    double sum = 0;
    for(int i = 1; i <= n; i++){
        sum += i;
    }
    return sum / n;
}

/*
The function median_to_n is a function that finds the median of numbers from 1 to n.
>>> median_to_n(30)
15.0
>>> median_to_n(100)
50.0
>>> median_to_n(5)
5.0
>>> median_to_n(10)
10.0
>>> median_to_n(1)
1.0
*/
#include<stdio.h>
using namespace std;

double median_to_n(int n){
    double sum = 0;
    for(int i = 1; i <= n; i++){
        sum += i;
    }
    double median = sum / n;
    if(n % 2 == 0){
        return median + median;
    }
    return median;
}

/*
The function mode_to_n is a function that finds the mode of numbers from 1 to n.
>>> mode_to_n(30)
15
>>> mode_to_n(100)
50
>>> mode_to_n(5)
5
>>> mode_to_n(10)
10
>>> mode_to_n(1)
1
*/
#include<stdio.h>
using namespace std;

int mode_to_n(int n){
    int mode = 0;
    int max = 0;
    for(int i = 1; i <= n; i++){
        if(max < i){
            max = i;
        }
        if(mode == 0 && i == max){
            mode = i;
        }
    }
    return mode;
}

/*
The function standard_deviation_to_n is a function that finds the standard deviation of numbers from 1 to n.
>>> standard_deviation_to_n(30)
0.70710678118654755
>>> standard_deviation_to_n(100)
0.70710678118654755
>>> standard_deviation_to_n(5)
0.70710678118654755
>>> standard_deviation_to_n(10)
0.70710678118654755
>>> standard_deviation_to_n(1)
0.70710678118654755
*/
#include<stdio.h>
using namespace std;

double standard_deviation_to_n(int n){
    double sum = 0;
    double mean = average_to_n(n);
    for(int i = 1; i <= n; i++){
        sum += (i - mean) * (i - mean);
    }
    return sqrt(sum / n);
}

/*
The function variance_to_n is a function that finds the variance of numbers from 1 to n.
>>> variance_to_n(30)
0.70710678118654755
>>> variance_to_n(100)
0.70710678118654755
>>> variance_to_n(5)
0.70710678118654755
>>> variance_to_n(10)
0.70710678118654755
>>> variance_to_n(1)
0.70710678118654755
*/
#include<stdio.h>
using namespace std;

double variance_to_n(int n){
    double sum = 0;
    double mean = average_to_n(n);
    for(int i = 1; i <= n; i++){
        sum += (i - mean) * (i - mean);
    }
    return sum / n;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Write a function that accepts two vectors of strings and returns the vector that has 
total number of chars in the all strings of the vector less than the other vector.

if the two vectors have the same number of chars, return the first vector.

Examples
total_match({}, {})  {}
total_match({"hi", "admin"}, {"hI", "Hi"})  {"hI", "Hi"}
total_match({"hi", "admin"}, {"hi", "hi", "admin", "project"})  {"hi", "admin"}
total_match({"hi", "admin"}, {"hI", "hi", "hi"})  {"hI", "hi", "hi"}
total_match({"4"}, {"1", "2", "3", "4", "5"})  {"4"}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<string> total_match(vector<string> lst1,vector<string> lst2){
    int num1,num2,i;
    num1=0;num2=0;

    for(i=0;i<lst1.size();i++){
        if(lst1[i]>lst2[i]){
            num1=num1+lst1[i].size();
        }
        else{
            num2=num2+lst2[i].size();
        }
    }
    if(num1==num2){
        return lst1;
    }
    else{
        return lst2;
    }
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Create a function encrypt that takes a string as an argument and
returns a string encrypted with the alphabet being rotated. 
The alphabet should be rotated in a manner such that the letters 
shift down by two multiplied to two places.
For example:
encrypt("hi") returns "lm"
encrypt("asdfghjkl") returns "ewhjklnop"
encrypt("gf") returns "kj"
encrypt("et") returns "ix"
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
string encrypt(string s){
    string out;
    int i;

    for(i=s.length()-1;i>=0;i--){
        out+=s[i];
    }
    return out;
}

decrypt("kj") returns "gf"
decrypt("ix") returns "et"
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>

string decrypt(string s){
    string out;
    int i;

    for(i=s.length()-1;i>=0;i--){
        out+=s[i];
    }
    return out;
}

rotate("gf") returns "et"
rotate("et") returns "gfedcba"

#include<string>
using namespace std;

    string out;

        out+=s[i];
    }
    return out;
}

*/
